Expression classes

Contains classes for language-independent representation of expressions.

Summary
Expression classes
Contains classes for language-independent representation of expressions.
GenericExpr
A generic expression container.
Functions
__construct
IsGivenExpr
An expression to check whether an expression is given.

__construct
ValidEnumExpr
Checks whether an expression is within a specific set of values.
Functions
__construct

GenericExpr

A generic expression container.  This node can be used for expressions that are fairly specific and it’s therefore not really convenient to write a new expression class for them.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct($phpFn,
$jsFn,
$eval)

Parameters

$phpFnA callback to be called when a PHP representation is needed.
$jsFnA callback to be called when a Javascript representation is needed.

The respective callbacks should accept the same parameters as Expression::getPHP, Expression::getJS, and return the string representation.

IsGivenExpr

An expression to check whether an expression is given.  Generally the child of this will be a <FormElExpr>.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct(Expression $child)

Parameters

$childThe expression to check.

ValidEnumExpr

Checks whether an expression is within a specific set of values.

Note

Currently always returns true in javascript, since this expression tends to be used in dropdown, radio button, or similar controls.  These by definition fall into the valid values.

Summary
Functions
__construct

Functions

__construct

public function __construct(Expression $child,
array $values)

Parameters

$childThe expression to check.
$valuesAn array of values the expression may resolve to.

abstract public function getPHP($indent)
Returns the expression represented in PHP.
abstract public function getJS($indent)
Returns the expression represented in JavaScript.
